intro: Isolepis podocarpa, commonly known as the narrowleaf spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh environments. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features slender, grass-like stems that are typically clustered in dense tufts. Its small, spike-like inflorescences contain numerous tiny flowers, which are wind-pollinated. Isolepis podocarpa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for wetland organisms.
